Like every MARTIN machine, the Martin T72A sliding table saw has been built for maximum performance. The Martin T72A is especially marked by the attention to detail. Since its foundation 90 years ago, the German manufacturer is producing high-quality woodworking machinery with cutting-edge performance and maximum precision. The family company Otto Martin Maschinenbau GmbH und Co. KG. combines innovative technology, user-friendly operating concepts and outstading durability. 

Product Pictures of Martin T72A

 

The Martin T 72A has a slide length of 3300 mm (with infinitely lockable anodized aluminium sliding carriage) and a maximum cutting height of 170 mm. The T72A from MARTIN is equipped with a 7.5 HP main saw motor with electronic brake. With a 400 mm main blade, there are three possible rotation blade speeds: 2800, 4000 & 5500 U/min.

The Martin T72A panel saw features a 2-axis controlled scoring unit with a 1 HP motor, powered adjustments of height and saw blade kerf. The MARTIN machine is completed with a 660 mm (26 in) x 1320 mm (26 in) traverse table, a telescoping crosscut fence with two flip-stops - also adjustable for miter cuts -, and an electronic rip fence with manual hand-crank. The T72A is also of course equipped with a digital display, which allows the operator to control the axes for the cutting height, cutting angle and cutting width. The operator is thus guided through work processes easily and accurately by the controller where all relevant information are quickly visible. In addition, it includes a parallelogram saw guard, a narrow and wide hood, an electronic locking of blade arbours, an anti-kickback splitter, as well as an automatic centralized lubrication for the sliding table.

Buyers looking for a vintage tractor should look no further than the FORD 800 Tractor Series. These classic red and gray tractors offer a stunning design that is a must for any collector of vintage farm tractors. A restored FORD 800 tractor for sale at auction offers a great addition to any collection.

FORD Tractor 800 Series Production History

The FORD Tractor 800 Series was a follow up to the FORD 600 Series. The new 40-horsepower tractors featured an improved 172

cubic inch engine and five-speed transmission as standard. The 800 Series included the FORD 820, 850 and 860 tractors. Dependent power take-off (PTO) was introduced with the 850, while the 860 was fitted with new live PTO. The 800 FORD tractor models were manufactured in Highland Park, Michigan from 1954 to 1957.

FORD 800 Tractor Specs

The FORD 820, 850 and 860 are fitted with 2.8-litre, four-cylinder FORD EAF gasoline or LP gas engines. Engines on the three models are liquid cooled. All 800 Series models are two-wheel drive tractors with a fuel capacity of 14 gallons or 53 litres. In addition to the FORD 800 tractor manual steering standard model, tractors with optional power assist steering are also found. All tractors have differential mechanical expanding show brakes and open operator stations. Although 800 Series models feature five forward and one reverse gears and a dry disc clutch, a major difference is transmission specs. The 820 has no transmission and PTO, while the FORD 850 and 860 boast an unsynchronised gear transmission and the 860 also has live PTO. While the 850 and 860 are equipped with three point hitches, the 820 does not. Buyers should carefully consult the FORD 800 manual for the specific model for sale to learn more.

FORD 800 Dimensions

All 800 Series tractors have an operating weight of 3,400 pounds or 1,542 kilograms. The FORD 820 has a wheelbase of 74.5 inches or 189 centimetres. It measures 113.6 inches or 288 centimetres long and 55.5 inches or 140 centimetres high. The 850 and 860 have the same dimensions, with a wheelbase of 75.18 inches or 190 centimetres. They are 121.8 inches or 309 centimetres long, 64.75 inches or 164 centimetres wide, and 59.3 inches or 150 centimetres tall.

110 JOHN DEERE Lawn Tractor

The JOHN DEERE 110 is one of the classic garden tractors still in existence. It offers excellent handling and an impressive power output. Otherwise known as the JD 110, this garden tractor was built between 1963 and 1974 as part of the "100 series" tractors offered by this well-known company. In fact, the JOHN DEERE 110 lawn tractor can actually be broken down into two separate categories. These are those with rounded fenders (1963 until 1967) and the square versions seen in subsequent versions. The next model up is the JOHN DEERE 210 and a larger variant can be seen in the JOHN DEERE 112 line. The original price for the JOHN DEERE 110 lawn tractor was $1,115 dollars (1974). Thus, anyone looking to buy used JOHN DEERE 110 mowers is likely to encounter substantial rebates. As with most other models, this unit is characterised by its green and yellow paint scheme. An open-air cab allows for easy operation.

JOHN DEERE 110 Garden Tractor Specs

The JOHN DEER 110 lawn tractor is powered by either a Kohler 161 engine (1963) or the slightly more advanced Kohler 181 (from 1964 until the end of production). Both are air-cooled petrol engines while the 181 series offers 305 cubic centimeters (the 161 only had 277). Both are air-cooled engines and each has one cylinder. This is the primary reason why up to ten horsepower is supplied by the JOHN DEERE 110 garden tractor.

The JOHN DEERE 110 garden tractor weighs only 615 pounds (258 kilograms). This makes it ideal for home use and light work. An overall length of 63 inches (160 centimeters) and a height of 38.75 inches (98 centimeters) also emphasise the rather diminutive dimensions of the 110 JOHN DEERE series. Still, a wheel base of 44 inches (11 centimeters) provides excellent stability. Two-wheel drive is only provided in the 110 series. An open-air cab further defines the JOHN DEERE 110 lawn tractor. Manual steering and brakes are also present; common for designs of this era. Its tank has the capacity to hold 1.9 gallons of petrol (7.2 liters).

INGERSOLL RAND is a leader in designing and manufacturing air compressors and air system accessories. Serving nearly 200 countries around the world, INGERSOLL RAND supplies a range of reciprocating compressors and air treatment systems. First introduced in 1929, the INGERSOLL RAND Type 30 (T30) is a leading reciprocating compressor for heavy duty applications.

About the Ingersoll-Rand T30

The INGERSOLL RAND Air Compressor T30 offers reliable performance and efficiency for a range of applications and sectors. The INGERSOLL-RAND T30 is a two-stage lubricated compressor with cast iron cylinders. It is designed for commercial and industrial use, including heavy shop use such as automotive service and body shops, construction, and manufacturing. The INGERSOLL-RAND Air Compressor T30 is available in Value or Premium packages with configurations that suit individual requirements and needs. Both packages are available with 11-bar receiver-mounted or a 14-bar base-mounted configuration. The economic Value package offers a reliable compressed air solution for mostly commercial and light industrial uses, including applications in the automotive sector. An INGERSOLL-RAND T30 for sale with the Premium package option delivers enhanced performance with additional features such as an air-cooled after cooler, low oil level switch, and an auto-condensate drain (available on receiver-mounted models only). The INGERSOLL RAND T30 compressor Premium package is well-suited for manufacturing and heavy duty industrial use.

Standard INGERSOLL-RAND T30 Specs

INGERSOLL-RAND T30 specs for individual units vary depending on whether the unit includes the Value package or the Premium package, as well as whether the unit is a speciality model. Specs also vary depending on the individual customisation of the model. Generally, the T30â€™s motor provides between 2.2 kilowatt (3 horsepower) and 22 kilowatt (horsepower) in output. The piston displacement of the T30 ranges from 290 to 2,932 litres per minute, and receiver-mounted models feature tanks with a capacity of between 200 and 500 litres. Each T30 unit weighs between 130 and 600 kilograms. The maximum pressure for the T30 is 11 bar(g) for receiver mounted models and 14 bar(g) for base mounted models.

T30 INGERSOLL RAND Specialty Models

The T30 INGERSOLL-RAND is available in different versions for specific applications. The T30 high pressure unit is designed for refuelling stations, power stations, engine starting, power stations and similar industries. This option is a base-mounted piston compressor that offers pressures of up to 345 bar(g). A non-lubricated option is also available. This version is ideal for textile industries as well as packaging and chemical sectors. Designed for applications where oil-free air is required, these units do not have oil in the cylinders. Oil-less compressors are also available for sectors that also require air-free environments, such as pharmaceutical, electronics, medical and food processing sectors. Vacuum compressor versions of the INGERSOLL-RAND T30 air compressor is also available for food packaging, processing plants, printing and vacuum cleaning applications.

INGERSOLL RAND T30 Air Compressor for Sale

If looking at INGERSOLL RAND T30 air compressor for sale at auction, carefully consider the end-use of the unit before making a bid. Individual models are designed for different applications and offer varying levels of performance. A used INGERSOLL RAND T30 air compressor can be an affordable addition for many commercial and industrial work settings. The INGERSOLL-RAND T30 price will vary depending on the type of the model, with Value package models costing less than Premium package and specialty versions.

A restored or used MASSEY FERGUSON 285 is a fine machine for buyers looking for tractors that showcase traditional design. An example of Massey Ferguson's legacy as a leading manufacturer of farm tractors, the 285 is a true classic.

MASSEY FERGUSON 285 Tractor Production History

The MASSEY FERGUSON 285 tractor was launched in 1974. It replaced the MASSEY FERGUSON 1080 standard-tread tractor, which was produced between 1969 and 1972. Production of the 285 tractor ended in 1982 when it was replaced by the MASSEY FERGUSON 298, which was introduced in 1983.

MASSEY FERGUSON 285 Specs

The type of engine found on the MASSEY FERGUSON 285 depends on the original market the tractor was originally intended for when it was built. European versions of the 285 MASSEY FERGUSON feature a Perkins A4.248 diesel engine. The 4.1-litre, four-cylinder engine is liquid cooled. Tractors made for the North American market have been fitted with 5.2-litre, four-cylinder Perkins A4.318 diesel engines. The North American engine is also liquid cooled. A MASSEY FERGUSON 285 for sale from original dealers were available with either 4x2 two-wheel drive or 4x4 four-wheel drive. Both versions are found on the market today. The 285 is also designed with hydrostatic power and wet disc brakes. Tractors without transmission offer operators eight forward to two reverse gears, while versions with partial power shift Multi-Power transmission have 12 forward and four reverse gears in addition to a dry disc clutch.

MF 285 Dimensions

The MF 285 has an operating weight of 7,650 pounds or 3,470 kilograms and a ballasted weight of 11,760 pounds or 5,334 kilograms. Its wheelbase is 88.75 inches or 225 centimetres. The tractor measures 146 inches or 370 centimetres long and it is 79 inches or 200 centimetres wide. It features a ground clearance of 16 inches or 40 centimetres.

One of the most popular tractors of its time, the JOHN DEERE 4020 was part of John Deere's New Generation Series. Available with two-wheel or four-wheel drive, the tractor was sold with diesel, gasoline and LP gas engines. JOHN DEERE 4020 Tractor Production History

The JOHN DEERE 4020 tractor was first introduced in 1963 as a replacement for the JOHN DEERE 4000 farm tractor. It was manufactured at John Deereâ€™s Waterloo, Iowa factory in the United States. The tractor JOHN DEERE 4020 was also made in a second factory in Mexico. Nearly 185,000 units of the JOHN DEER 4020 were produced, including standard, row crop and high-crop versions. A wide-front variant of the tractor was also available. Production of the JD 4020 ceased in 1972 and the successful tractor was replaced by the JOHN DEERE 4320.

JOHN DEERE 4020 Specs

The 4020 JOHN DEERE tractor is fitted with a 6.6-litre, six-cylinder John Deere diesel engines. A 4020 JOHN DEERE for sale from original suppliers was also available with 5.6- and 5.9-litre, six-cylinder gasoline engines and a 5.9-litre, six-cylinder LP gas engine were also available. Oil capacity in earlier models is 8 quarts, although this increases to 12 in models made in 1969 and afterwards with the exception of high-crop diesel models. Fuel capacity ranges from 34 gallons or 128.7 litres for gasoline and LP gas versions to 45 gallons or 170.3 litres for diesel models. The tractor features Syncro-Range partially synchronised transmission with eight forward and two reverse gears. This requires tractors to be stopped with the clutch depressed in order to select one of four shift stations. With a shift station selected, operators can move between two forward gears when using the clutch.
Power Shift transmission is also found on these tractors and allows operators to shift between gears without the clutch. Other features include hydraulic power steering and hydraulic wet disc brakes. An optional rear differential lock is found on some 4020 tractors. The 4020 JOHN DEERE has an operating weigh between 8,645 pounds or 3,773 kilograms and 9,560 pounds or 4,191 depending on the configuration and type. The standard model has a wheelbase of 100.25 inches or 254 centimetres, while the wheelbase for the row crop version is 97.5 inches or 247 centimetres. The row-crop version is 77.9 inches or 197 centimetres high, while the standard version measures up to 88.75 inches or 225 centimetres high. Bomag BW120AD-4 Tandem Roller

The BW120AD-4 is a high-performance tandem vibratory roller manufactured by BOMAG. Since the 1980's, BOMAG tandem models have redefined performance standards for light tandem rollers. Established as the "benchmark" on the roller market, they combine compact size and high maneuvrability. Very popular because of their ease of operation, BOMAG light and tandem rollers can perform a wide variety of tasks with optimum results.

 

As part of the Dash 4 Series from BOMAG, the BW120AD-4 is characterized by its increased productivity, improved satefy details and high operator comfort. Slanted drum support legs with curb clearance ensure high visibility on the drum edges and provide the ability to work closely to obstructions and in tight areas. The Bomag BW120AD-4 tandem vibratory roller may be useful in applications such as asphalt and sub-base compaction; walkways, bicycle and cart paths; landscaping; driveways and parking lots; as well as road rehabilitation and patching.

The BW120AD4 two position throttle offers two vibration frequencies and high amplitudes for optimized compaction on a wide range of material types. In order to prevent over compaction and material damage to thin lift applications, the vibration can be selectively cut-off on the rear drum. Providing maximum versatility and maintaining a high residual value, the Bomag BW120AD-4 tandem light roller has an operating weight of 2.6 tonnes, an operating width of 1,2 m, and is 2,47 m long.

Deckel FP4A Room Milling Machine

The 1980's period DECKEL FP4a all inclusive processing and exhausting machine offers the client powerful robustness and solidness. The machine uses a Ultimax 2 double screen CNC control furthermore includes a coolant framework. The machine was fabricated in the 1990's.

The FP4A and FP4MA fundamentally began as an advancement of the completely routine FP4M .

As a run of the mill customary Deckel processing machine the FP4M connected with the z and x-pivot by means of a typical lever and the z hub was moved through a handwheel situated on the seat.

At the point when a control and drives were intricately slapped on this setup it brought about the FP4A (A may well have remained for "mechanized"), which because of its mechanics could at present just draw in either the z or the y pivot, yet not both all the while. This mechanical restriction made it a 2.5 D machine. Since it could just move 2 pivot all the while, it just had 2 Bosch hub sets, and no extra sets could be introduced, bringing about the way that no controlled Deckel embellishments could be utilized.

Deckel FP4CCT Highlights

The Deckel FP4CCT is a CNC industrial milling machine with a tool changer, oil tank and coolant system, and hydraulic tool clamping which cane be adjusted horizontally or vertically via a sliding head. The active tool can be changed in the program while the machine is processing. The manufacturing year is approximately 1988. It has an infinitely variable-speed range of 18-6300 rpm, feed range 2-10000 mm per minute. The rapid transverse is 10000 mm per minute. The total installed power is 23 kVA and has a 26 tool capacity in the changer.

Deckel FP4 CCT history

The company which produced the Deckel FP4CCT originated in Munich, Germany in 1903. By 1994, after a long history as a maker of folding camera shutters, machine-tools, and injection pumps, the Deckel company was taken over in bankruptcy by the Gildemeister AG, Bielefeld. Its production had been decreasing, at one point 42% in one year. That, combined with alleged deep-rooted disputes between the owners (who were family) as well as some serious mistakes within company policy meant that Deckel came to a permanent halt. These machines were once thought of as the "Rolls Royce" of industrial machines and become available selectively by those who value quality.

TRUMPF Group History

The TRUMPF Group of Germany produces electronics, lasers, and machine tools for use in the industrial sectors. Their manufactured products have been used to build vehicles, data storage, mobile devices, building technology and other such things. It is a global company which is still family owned and run. TRUMPF has been in business in Germany since 1923, and started with flexible cables and shafts for dental and printing use. As the company evolved, they began developing hand-guided machines for fabrication uses. TRUMPF Group became known for its nibbling and punch tool machines. This row-crop tractor is part of the popular PowerStar 40 series and replaced the FORD 7610. This model lives up to the FORD 7000 legacy of being an iconic tractor that can handle even the toughest of jobs. 

FORD 7740 Specs & Features 

The design and style of the 7740 FORD perfect match for the ideal of an English working tractor and this mighty model perfectly fits into the British countryside. A FORD 7740 tractor features a 5-cylinder diesel engine from FORD that was specially created for the PowerStar 40 series and that delivers a mighty 86 horsepower (64.1 kW) with a fuel capacity of 94.6 litres (25 gallons).

Some of the specs include shipping weight of the FORD 7740 tractor ranges between 7,312 (3,316) and 9,194 pounds (4,170 kilogrammes) while its wheelbase measures 93 inches (236 centimetres). This row-crop tractor is 162 inches (411 cm) long, 107 inches (271 cm) tall to the top of the cab, and 77 inches (195 cm) or 80 inches (203 cm) wide, respectively for the 2WD and 4WD models. The rear PTO is independent while the rear lift delivers an impressive 2,816 kg (6,210 lbs). The model features two-wheel drive as standard while four-wheel drive is one of the many optional extras that the 7740 offers. Concerning FORD 7740 specifications, the open centre hydraulics feature between one and four valves depending on the year of manufacture of the FORD 7740 for sale.

Reasons to Purchase Used FORD 7740 Tractor

For traditionalists, the 7740 FORD is the perfect model to work on a medium sized or large farm. A large number of models of used FORD 7740 are for sale are available in the United Kingdom at an attractive price and, due to the popularity of this model during the 1990s, parts for the 7740 FORD tractor are easy to come by. Also, a used Ford 7740 can be easily located at second-hand markets due to its popularity. Please check our wide selection of used Ford 7740 tractor to compare prices, specs and chose the right used 7740 tractors for you.

FORD 7840 Farming Tractor

The FORD 7840 was produced from 1991 until 1995 in the FORD company’s Basildon factory (England). This top of the range row-crop tractor from the PowerStar 40 series was manufactured to replace the FORD 7810. It has been supplied in three variants: the 7840S with 8-speed (economy), the 7840SL with 12-speed and the 7840SLE with 16-speed (premium).

Used 7840 Ford Farming Tractor

Even though the production of this tractor has come to a stop back at 1995, this tractor still remains popular on farms around the world as used tractor. The high standards of the Ford corp. guarantee almost every time that you will get the best used 7840 tractors out there. Here you can find a wide selection of used 7840 Ford tractors to compare prices. 

 

FORD 7840 Tractor for Sale

The 7840 is an iconic tractor that was built to last. The striking style and design of the 7840 FORD were selected to especially appeal to British farmers who required a very versatile and tough vehicle. The model boasts a FORD six-cylinder diesel engine that delivers an impressive 90 hp (67.1 kW) and has a fuel capacity of 217.6 litres (57.5 gals), making it one of the most powerful utility tractors of the 1990s. While two-wheel drive comes as standard with the 7840, a four-wheel drive variation is also available.

FORD 7840 Specs

The FORD 7840 has a weight of 8,076 (3663) to 10,274 pounds (4660 kilograms) and a rear lift that provides a mighty 6,210 lbs (2,816 kg). The wheelbase on the 4-wheel drive variation is 261 centimetres (103 inches) while this rises slightly to 269 centimetres (106 in) with the standard 2WD model. Furthermore, the farm tractor FORD 7840 has a length of 447 cm (176 inches), a width of 210 cm (83 inches), and a height of 279 cm (110 inches) to the top of the cab. Another FORD 7840 specification is the cab, which is specially designed to be comfortable during a long operation, featuring an adjustable seat and optional air conditioning.

Reasons to Check Out the 7840 FORD

The FORD 7840 tractor is the ideal model to work on large farms. The popularity of this tractor means that a good number of models of the FORD 7840 for sale can be found at an affordable price while finding FORD 7840 tractor parts or equipment for this model (such as loader for example) is simple.

Part of FORD’s 800 Series, the red and gray FORD 850 unique design makes it stand out among other machines in a classic tractor collection. A FORD 850 for sale at auction provides buyers with a distinct addition for their collections.

FORD 850 Production History

The FORD 850 tractor was built at FORD's Highland Park, Michigan factory in the United States between 1954 and 1957. Three variants of the 850 were made. The standard 850 featured transmission power take-off (PTO), while the FORD 860 was designed with live PTO. The FORD 820 had no three-point hitch or hydraulics. After its production run, the 850 was replaced by the FORD 851.

FORD 850 Specs

The 850 has a four-cylinder, 2.8-litre FORD EAF gasoline or LP gas engine. With five forward gears and one reverse gear, the tractor is fitted with unsynchronised gear transmission with a dry disc clutch. Other FORD 850 specifications and features include a 14-gallon (53-litre) fuel tank, two-wheel drive, a Category I three-point hitch with a rear lift capacity of 1,250 pounds (567 kilograms), and differential mechanical expanding shoe brakes. A FORD 850 tractor for sale during its production run was fitted with manual or power assist steering, depending on which option was selected by the original buyer.

850 FORD Tractor Dimensions

The 850 FORD is a larger version of the FORD 650, which was also produced during the 1950s. The tractor has an operating weight of 3,400 pounds (1,542 kg) and a ballasted weight of 6,700 pounds (3,039 kg). Its wheelbase is 121.8 inches (309 centimetres). The FORD model 850 tractor is 121.8 inches (309 cm) long, 64.75 inches (164 cm) wide, and 59.3 inches (150 cm) tall.

Introduced in 1992, the FORD 5030 tractor continues to be a strong machine for land management and material handling operations. The last tractor was produced in 1999. A used FORD 5030 provides buyers with an affordable and effective alternative to buying new.

FORD 5030 Specifications & Features

The FORD 5030 is equipped with a 4.2-litre, four-cylinder diesel engine from FORD with a PTO of 62 hp (46.2 kW). It features partial power shift transmission, which delivers 16 forward and 8 reverse gears. A FORD 5030 for sale during its production run was available with two- or four-wheel drive, and some were fitted with an optional cab. Other FORD 5030 tractor specs include transmission rear power take-off (PTO), hydrostatic power steering, differential wet disc brakes, and a two-post rollover protective structure. This utility tractor is fitted with a Category I three-point hitch with a rear lift capacity of 3,075 pounds (1,394 kilograms). It is also equipped with a 17.3-gallon (48.1-litre) fuel tank.

5030 FORD Tractor Dimensions

The 5030 FORD has a ballasted weight of 8,250 pounds (3,742 kg). The operating weight of the tractor depends on whether it is a two- or four-wheel drive version. For example, a FORD 5030 4WD tractor without a cab has an operating weight of 5,988 pounds (2,716 kg). The tractor’s wheelbase is 89.6 inches (or 227 centimetres).

Part of FORD’s Hundred Compact Series, a FORD 1700 for sale today is an opportunity to own a modern classic model at a very reasonable price. Refurbished tractors are also used for occasional operations. The Japanese-built 1700 compact utility tractor was produced from 1979 to 1982, when it was replaced by the FORD 1710.

FORD 1700 Specs

A successor to the 1600, the FORD 1700 features a Shibaura LE 892 two-cylinder, 1.3-litre diesel engine that produces 25 hp (18.6 kW). It has gear transmission with 12 forward and four reverse gears. Other FORD 1700 tractor specifications include a Category I three-pitch hitch with a rear lift capacity of 3,813 pounds (or 1,729 kilograms), live hydraulics, manual steering, differential mechanical drum brakes, and a two-post roll-over protective structure. It is designed with transmission rear power take-off (PTO) and optional front PTO. A FORD 1700 tractor for sale during its original production run was available with two- or four-wheel drive.

FORD 1700 Tractor Dimensions

The 1700 FORD is smaller than the FORD 1900 tractor and larger than the FORD 1500, all of which were part of the Hundred Compact Series. FORD 1700 specs depend on whether the tractor has two- or four-wheel drive. The 2WD version has a wheelbase of 60.2 inches (152 centimetres) and weighs 2,326 pounds (1,055 kilograms) while the 4WD model’s wheelbase is 59.3 inches (150 cm) and weighs 2,513 pounds (1,139 kg). This compact tractor is only 110.6 inches (280 cm) long and 59.3 inches (150 cm) wide.

The FORD 5640 tractor was produced at FORD'S Basildon factory from 1991 until 1995. Part of the Powerstar 40 series, this model is described as a utility tractor and is identical to the NEW HOLLAND 5640. It was the successor to the FORD 5610.

FORD 5640 Tractor

The FORD 5640 is powered by a FORD 4 cylinder 4.4 litre diesel engine which produces 66 hp (PTO). It was produced in three versions and, if looking at a FORD 5640 for sale, regard should be had to the model suffix. The 5640S was the basic model with 8 forward and 2 reverse gears (4 speed plus H/L), whereas the 5640SL had 12 speeds and the 5640SLE 16 speeds. The 5640 was either 2WD or optionally 4WD. Concerning FORD 5640 specs, other model differences of note are the diff-lock which is mechanical on the S and electro-hydraulic on the SL and SLE. Braking is mechanical on the S and hydraulic (wet disc) on the SL and SLE.

The FORD 8600 was manufactured in a four-year period, between the years 1972 to 1976. As with all Ford tractors, a used FORD 8600 is a very reliable and durable model, which has maintained its popularity over the years.

FORD 8600 Specs for the Engine & Transmission

The FORD 8600 tractor has a 6-cylinder liquid-cooled diesel engine that is dry air cleaned. The FORD 8600 engine has compression of 16.5:1, and rated RPM of 2300. The tractor´s transmission has a ratio of 8/2. It has eight forward gears and four reverse. The fuel tank capacity is 43 gallons (162.8 litres) and the hydraulic system capacity is 16 gallons (60.6 litres).

FORD 8600 Specifications for the Body

The FORD 8600 for sale has an operational weight of 5184 kilograms (11,430 lbs) and a ballasted weight of 6708 kg (14,790 lbs). The tractor all-purpose length is 376 centimetres (148.3 inches), and the width is 215 centimetres (85 inches). The 8600 FORD has a wheelbase of 232 centimetres or 91.5 inches (all purpose). The height of the exhaust from the floor is 269 centimetres (106 inches). Furthermore, this tractor has a 2WD turn radius of 4.6 metres (15 feet).

The JOHN DEERE 7810 is a 175 horsepower (130.5 kW) row-crop tractor manufactured from 1997 to 2003.

JOHN DEERE 7810 for Sale

Included in the 7010 Series, this JOHN DEERE 7810 tractor has a 8.1L turbocharged aftercooled diesel engine with 6 cylinders. At the PTO, there is 150 hp (111.9 kW) available to power rotary implements at 540 or 1000 RPM. The PTO can be independently controlled using a hydraulic wet disc clutch, which means that the farm tractor can be stationary while the PTO is still running. Concerning JOHN DEERE 7810 equipment, the 3-point hitch connecting implements to the rear can lift up to 8,925 lbs (4048 kg) using PFC hydraulics – useful for when turning the JD 7810 or moving implements.

JOHN DEERE 7810 Specs

The JOHN DEERE 7810 specifications for the dimensions show that this tractor is 187 inches (474 cm) long and is 118.5 inches (300 cm) tall, which allows for a spacious cab to be fitted. From this standard cab, the JOHN DEERE 7810 is turned precisely using hydrostatic power and slowed down with hydraulic wet disc brakes. To more efficiently move through difficult ground, the operator can activate the MFWD 4WD option which provides greater speed and traction.

7810 JOHN DEERE Tractor for Sale

With the ROPS bar included, this 7810 JOHN DEERE for sale can be topped-up with 71.5 gallons (270.6 litres) of diesel, providing plenty of fuel for long operations. A used JOHN DEERE 7810 will weigh 13,910 lbs (6309 kg), so having such a generous fuel capacity to move this machine is vital. Stability is also important. With a 100.2 inch (254 cm) wheelbase on this 7810 JOHN DEERE supporting large 11 and 18.4 inch wide tyres (2WD), uneven soil and soft terrain can be powered through easily and safely.

Part of the 7030 Series, the JOHN DEERE 7930 is a row-crop tractor made in Waterloo (Iowa), United States, between 2007 and 2011. The previous model was a JOHN DEERE 7920 and the next model up is the JD 7260R. It is manufactured with a mechanical front wheel drive, 4-wheel drive chassis which comes with hydrostatic power steering and hydraulic wet disc brakes. The JD 7930 also comes with an air-conditioned cab as standard.

JOHN DEERE 7930 Specifications

The JOHN DEERE 7930 for sale has a rear mounted Category III type 3-point hitch attached which has a maximum load lift of 10,050 lbs (or 4558 kilograms). If required however as an optional extra this can be increased to 14,000 lbs (6350 kilograms) and the tractor can be equipped with loader. The JD 7930 benefits from a 6.8-litre intercooled, turbocharged 6-cylinder diesel engine that is liquid cooled and which delivers 220 hp (164.1 kW). Concerning other JOHN DEERE 7930 specs, the fuel tank has a capacity of 103 gallons (or 389.9 litres) unless the row-crop tractor has right hand steps in which case this is reduced to 94 gallons (355.8 litres).

The JOHN DEERE 7930 tractor has three types of transmission available (see 7930 reviews for further technical details). The basic model comes with the JOHN DEERE PowrQuad Plus which has 16 forward and reverse gears. Alternatives to this are the JOHN DEERE AutoQuad Plus transmission which has 20 forward and reverse gears or the Infinitely Variable Transmission (IVT) which has an infinite number of forward and reverse gears.

7930 JOHN DEERE Dimensions

This used JOHN DEERE 7930 has a wheelbase of 112.6 inches (286 centimetres) and a weight of 17,200 lbs (7801 kilograms). The length and width are 225 inches (571 cm) and 96 inches (243 cm) respectively. Additionally, the JOHN DEER 7930 has a height of 121 inches (307 cm) and a ground clearance of 22.3 inches (56 cm).

Built in Germany, the JOHN DEERE 6400 was launched in 1992 as a replacement for the JOHN DEERE 2955. The simple and economical utility tractor was produced until 1998. A low-profile version known as the 6400L was also made. A JOHN DEERE 6400 for sale today is an effective machine at the right price for farm operators looking to save without compromising safety and productivity (see 6400 review).

JOHN DEERE 6400 Specs

The 85-horsepower (63.4 kW) JD 6400 is fitted with a JOHN DEERE CD4045 turbocharged diesel engine. This four-cylinder, 4.5-litre engine is liquid cooled and includes a fuel pump. The standard JOHN DEERE SyncroPlus transmission on the tractor is the fully synchronised. Certain used JOHN DEERE 6400 tractors may have optional JOHN DEERE PowrQuad transmission, a partial power shift alternative with four gears in four synchronised ranges and a power shuttle. This offers operators 16 forward and reverse gears, compared to 12 forward and four reverse gears on the standard model. Other JOHN DEERE 6400 specifications include a Category II three-point hitch with lower link control and a rear lift capacity of 5,915 pounds (or 2,683 kilograms). The 6400 JOHN DEERE has two- or four-wheel drive. Closed-centre pressure flow compensated hydraulics, hydrostatic power steering, and hydraulic wet disc brakes are also included. JOHN DEERE 620, 640NSL and 640SL loaders are compatible with this farm tractor, as well as other JOHN DEERE 6400 equipment.

Dimensions of JOHN DEERE 6400 Tractor

Part of the 6000 Series of tractors, the JOHN DEERE 6400 tractor is larger than the JOHN DEERE 6300. Two-wheel drive versions weight between 7,607 and 8,114 pounds (3,450 and 3,680 kg) depending on whether or not a cab is included. Four-wheel drive versions weight 8,246 pounds (3,740 kg) with only a roll-over protective structure and 8,754 pounds (3,970 kg) with a cab. The JOHN DEER 6400 has a wheelbase of 94.5 inches or 240 centimetres.

The JOHN DEERE 6430 tractor offers operators excellent visibility and easy-to-use controls. A powerful tool for farm operations, the tractor is designed for tilling, seeding, and discing (for further details, see JOHN DEERE 6430 reviews).

JOHN DEERE 6430 Production History

The JOHN DEERE 6430 entered the tractor market in 2007. The farm tractor was made by JOHN DEERE at its Mannheim factory in Germany. In addition to the standard model, an enhanced version - the JOHN DEERE 6430 Premium - was also sold with a premium cab and upgraded features at a slightly higher price. Part of the 6030 Series, the 6430 was a replacement for the JOHN DEERE 6420. The JD 6430 was discontinued in 2012.

JOHN DEERE 6430 Specs

A 120-horsepower JOHN DEERE four-cylinder, 4.5-litre 4045HL281 PowerTech E diesel engine is found on models built between 2007 and 2009, while the JOHN DEERE 4045HL288 PowerTech E diesel engine is installed in tractors made between 2010 and 2012. Other JOHN DEERE 6430 specifications include hydrostatic power steering, hydraulic wet disc brakes, and a two-post roll-over protection system with or without a cab. In addition to standard two-wheel drive, a used JOHN DEERE 6430 for sale today may feature optional four-wheel drive.

A JOHN DEERE 6430 for sale from original dealers could be fitted different transmissions, which means buyers of used tractors will fine one of three types. Certain tractors are fitted with JOHN DEERE SychroPlus fully synchronised transmission with 12 forward and four reverse gears or JOHN DEERE PowrReverser synchronised transmission with power shuttle and 16 forward and reverse gears. Other 6430 model tractors have JOHN DEERE PowrQuad partial power shift transmission with 16 or 24 forward and reverse gears.

Originally established in 1837, Deere & Company has grown to become the largest agricultural machinery company in the world. The JOHN DEERE brand is recognised worldwide and a buoyant second-hand market exists for used JOHN DEERE tractors, including the JOHN DEERE 6910 tractor. New, or small, farming ventures may find that a used JOHN DEERE 6910 is more economically viable than a new model (see above JOHN DEERE 6910 price), while used farm equipment might also be suitable for less intensive farming tasks.

JOHN DEERE 6910 Specs

The JOHN DEERE 6910 features a six-cylinder, 6.8-litre, turbocharged, diesel engine, which realises maximum power of 140 horsepower (104 kW) and a maximum torque of 450 lb-ft (610 Nm) at 1,400 rpm. Generally speaking, diesel engines are more efficient and more economical than petrol engines of the same size. The JOHN DEER 6910 puts down its power via the proprietary JOHN DEERE PowrQuad transmission and 24 forward and reverse gears. Other JOHN DEERE 6910 tractors include a full power shift JOHN DEERE PowrShift transmission with 18 forward and 7 reverse gears, or can be fitted with the JOHN DEERE 6910 Autopower with infinite forward and reverse gears. The JD 6910 has a fuel capacity of 55 gallons (207 litres) and a maximum allowed weight of 22,035 pounds (9,995 kilograms).

JOHN DEERE 6910 for Sale

The MASSEY FERGUSON 135, manufactured by MASSEY FERGUSON Ltd., is a utility tractor – the first model of the MF 100 Series launched in the 1960s. MASSEY FERGUSON Limited was formed in 1953 through a merger between Massey Harris & Ferguson Company, creating Massey Harris Ferguson. Today, the company exists by the brand name of AGCO. Manufactured between 1964 and 1975, the MF135 tractor was extremely popular thanks to its power and reliability (see MASSEY FERGUSON 135 review).

MASSEY FERGUSON 135 Specs

The 135 MASSEY FERGUSON has an engine with a power rating of 45.5 horsepower (33.9 kW) and compression of 17.4:1. There are four variants based on the engine fitted: two of gasoline run variants by Continental and two of Perkins (1 gasoline & 1 diesel run). The MASSEY FERGUSON 135 diesel has a 3-cylinder, liquid cooled engine with a rated RPM of 2000. The fuel capacity of MASSEY FERGUSON 135 tractor is 10.2 gallons (38.6 litres) or 12.6 gallons (47.7 L) for the late one, and its hydraulic system capacity is 8 gallons (30.3 L). In hydraulics, the oil type used is MF–1129, pressure is around 2800 psi (193.1 bar) and pump flow reaches 4.5 gallons per minute (17.0 lpm).

Going into MASSEY FERGUSON 135 specifications, the rear PTO is through transmission (gear transmission – 6 forward and 2 reverse gears) and the count for rear revolutions per minute (RPM) is 540. In addition, the tractor employs a manual steering (power steering optional), an open operator station cab, a two-wheel drive chassis and mechanical drum brakes. Electrically speaking, the 135 MASSEY FERGUSON possesses a negative ground, with a generator-based charging system and a charging requirement of 10 amperes. .

Concerning the dimensions of the tractor MASSEY FERGUSON 135, the wheelbase measures 72 inches (182 cm). Moreover, the MASSEY FERGUSON MF 135 weighs around 3565 to 3810 pounds (1653 to 1728 kilograms).

 

MASSEY FERGUSON 135 for Sale

In the MASSEY FERGUSON 135 tractor for sale, the serial numbers are written on the instrument panel below the steering column. Even though new innovations and modifications have come about since its inception, a used MASSEY FERGUSON 135 is till date a great farm tool, in particular thanks to the quality of MASSEY FERGUSON 135 parts. The standard sturdy features have been retained, if not bettered in the later versions of the MF 135. In a nutshell, this tractor offers features – in all its variants (diesel/gasoline) – that are a great value for money.

The MASSEY FERGUSON 165 tractor was one of the MASSEY FERGUSON 100 Series of tractors. The 58-horsepower (43.5 kW) row-crop tractor was produced in the 1960s and 1970s. A MASSEY FERGUSON 165 for sale today is a good option for buyers looking to add classic tractors to their collection for a reasonable price.

MASSEY FERGUSON 165 Production History

The MASSEY FERGUSON 165 was part of a revamped line of the manufacturer’s range of tractor models. The new tractors were designed with common parts and specifications, styling across all markets. Introduced in 1964, the MF 165 replaced the earlier MF 65 tractor. The standard version of the tractor features a fixed wide-front, while variants of the 165 include a wide row-crop version with an adjustable wide-front and a tricycle with an narrow row-crop front. In 1975, production of the 165 MASSEY FERGUSON ended and the model was replaced with the MF 265.

 

MASSEY FERGUSON 165 Specs

The MASSEY FERGUSON 165 is equipped with three-cylinder, 2.5-litre Perkins AD3.152 diesel engines or Perkins AG3.152 gasoline engines. Some 165 MASSEY FERGUSON tractors may also feature a four-cylinder, 2.4-litre Continental Z-145 gasoline engine. The tractors are fitted with a transmission with a dry plate clutch and eight forward and two reverse gears. A second hand MASSEY FERGUSON 165 might also have multipower transmission with partial power shift, a dry plate clutch, and 12 forward and four reverse gears. Other MASSEY FERGUSON 165 specifications include a fuel capacity of 18.5 gallons (70 litres), two-wheel drive chassis, power assist steering, differential mechanical disc brakes, an open operator station, and optional two-post roll-over protection and canopy (see MASSEY FERGUSON 165 reviews).

A used MASSEY FERGUSON 165 has an operating weight of approximately 5,000 pounds (2,268 kilograms), although the exact weight depends on the version of the MF 165 tractor. The wheelbase of this row-crop tractor is 81.1 inches or 205 centimetres. It is 131.5 inches (334 cm) long, 63.4 inches (161 cm) wide, and 65 inches (165 cm) tall at the steering wheel.

The 46-horsepower (34.3 kW) MASSEY FERGUSON 240 tractor is a powerful utility tractor original produced in the early 1980s until the late 1990s. Restored and used 240s provide homeowners and professional operators with a durable and reliable machine for a wide range of applications. Buying a MASSEY FERGUSON 240 for sale at auction is an affordable alternative (see above MASSEY FERGUSON 240 price) to purchasing a new tractor.

MASSEY FERGUSON 240 Production History

The MASSEY FERGUSON 240 was introduced in 1979 on the UK market, whereas North American production only began in 1983. Past of the 200 Series of utility tractors, the 240 was a smaller variant of the MASSEY FERGUSON 250. The tractor was manufactured by MASSEY FERGUSON in Coventry, England. The 240 MASSEY FERGUSON was also produced under license by Uzel for MASSEY FERGUSON in Turkey. A version of the 240 was also made under license by Millat in Pakistan. The MF 240 replaced the MASSEY FERGUSON 230. The last 240 was made in 1999.

MASSEY FERGUSON 240 Specs

A used MASSEY FERGUSON 240 is fitted with a 2.5-litre, three-cylinder Perkins diesel engine with oil filter. The fuel capacity on the tractor is 12.6 gallons (or 47.7 litres). Other MASSEY FERGUSON 240 specifications include sliding gear with eight forward and two reverse gears, live rear power-take off (PTO), hydrostatic power steering, and two-post roll-over protection. Early models feature mechanical drum brakes, while later versions of the 240 have differential mechanical wet disc brakes, as well as other parts. In addition to the standard two-wheel drive version, the 240 MASSEY FERGUSON tractor is available with a mechanical front wheel drive, four-wheel drive chassis.

MF 240 Dimensions

The two-wheel drive version of the MF 240 weighs 4,015 pounds (1,821 kilograms), while the four-wheel drive model is 4,585 pounds (2,079 kg). The two-wheel drive 240 has a wheelbase of 76.1 inches (193 centimetres) and is 124.6 inches (316 cm) long. The four-wheel drive 240 has a wheelbase of 77 inches (195 cm) and is 127.1 inches (322 cm) long. Both models are 66.1 inches (167 cm) wide. 

The MASSEY FERGUSON 240 utility tractor is compatible with the MASSEY FERGUSON 232 loader and the larger MF 236 loader. The 232 loader is 106 inches (269 cm) high, while the 236 is 125 inches (317 cm) high.

The JOHN DEERE 455 garden tractor was a top-of-the-line ride-on mower when it was produced during the 1990s. It was the manufacturer’s flagship garden tractor for nearly a decade.

JOHN DEERE 455 Production History

The JOHN DEERE 455 was first introduced in 1992. Part of John Deere’s 400 Series, the garden tractor was produced at the manufacturer’s Horicon, Wisconsin factory in the United States. The 455 JOHN DEERE replaced the 430 and was eventually succeeded by the JOHN DEERE X495. It was a larger version of the JOHN DEERE 445. Production of the JOHN DEERE 455 diesel tractor ended in 2011.

JOHN DEERE 455 Specs

The JD 455 was fitted with a three-cylinder, 881-cc Yanmar diesel engine. It was also equipped with a Tuff Torq K91 transmission that offered infinite forward and reverses gears. The 22-horsepower (16.4 kW) garden tractor reached forward speeds of up to 8.5 miles per hour (or 13.7 km/h). It featured a mid-body 2000 rpm power take-off (PTO). An option for a 540 rpm rear PTO was also available as an add-on. Other JOHN DEERE 455 lawn tractor specifications included hydrostatic power steering and differential lock as standard. An original JOHN DEERE 455 for sale from dealers was also available with four-wheel steering as an option.

The standard version of the tractor weighed 956 pounds (437 kilograms) and had a wheelbase of 50.4 inches (128 centimetres). The all-wheel steering model weighed 1,060 pounds (480 kg) and featured a smaller wheelbase of 49.4 inches (125 cm). The 455 measured 75 inches (190 cm) in length and 48 inches (121 cm) in width. It was 51.2 inches (130 cm) high. The JOHN DEERE 455 lawn mower was available with 48-, 54- and 60-inche mower deck attachments. The 54-inch mower deck was included as standard with the 455 model from JOHN DEERE. Additional optional attachments include a 46- or 47-inch snow blower, blade, and front-end loader.

For further details, please refer to the JOHN DEERE 455 manual (official operator's manual from JOHN DEERE).

Used JOHN DEERE 455 for Sale

A used JOHN DEERE 455 for sale at auction can be a valuable addition for maintaining gardens, lawns and other grounds at an affordable price. Collectors looking to buy JOHN DEERE 455 tractors as collectibles may find earlier models more highly sought. However, this garden tractor generally retains a strong market value. If well maintained or restored, this tractor - and, of course, its parts - is primarily a reliable choice for using to maintain gardens and lawns. Tractors with rear PTO and three-point hitch options, as well as lock-out valve options, are often sought-after and harder to find.

Whether it's at home or a small gardening business a used John Deere garden tractor is a must have in ones tractors fleet or tool shed. John Deer produce one of the best tractors in the field and the cost like such. It is popular to buy used John Deere garden tractors as they can be expensive.

An INTERNATIONAL 300 utility tractor for sale at auction is a great find for collectors of vintage tractors. Built in the mid-1950s, the classic tractor is also a good option for operators looking for a simpler alternative to today’s technology-heavy utility tractors.

INTERNATIONAL 300 Tractor Production History

In 1955, INTERNATIONAL HARVESTER launched its first ‘hundred-series’ range of tractors. Although most models in the lineup only had slightly modified designs and only a few new features when compared to models released in 1939, the new series include a new utility tractor. The INTERNATIONAL 300 tractor was the only new addition to the manufacturer’s tractor line-up in 1955. A row-crop variant of the 300 was also produced by Farmall as the FARMALL 300. The IH 300 was only produced until 1956, when it was replaced by the INTERNATIONAL HARVESTER 350.

General Characteristics and Uses of the Ford Tractor 1210

Manufactured between 1983 and 1986, the 1210 Ford tractor was a compact utility model produced out of Japan by the Shibaura Corporation. This variant was primarily used for agricultural purposes and one of its defining characteristics was the trademark blue paint that was used for its chassis. As should stand to reason, the previous model was the Ford 1200 and the subsequent version was the Ford 1220. Another interesting feature of the 1210 Ford was its ability to accommodate for other mechanical items such as a snow blower, a front-end loader, backhoe or even  become a mower. Still, this tractor was only produced for four years before being upgraded to the 1220 model.

NORTON Jumbo 900 Circular Saw History

Norton company was originally a pottery factory in 1858. Grinding wheels were in high demand, along with the use of abrasive materials to sharpen and polish. A potter working at the company innovated the concept of covering the wheels with Emery. This led to a patent for vitrified grinding wheels in 1876, and between then and now plants spread across Germany, France, the UK, Italy, Brazil, India and Japan.

The sawmill LAIMET 120

The LAIMET 120 circular saw mill is the best-selling product in the LAIMET product range. It is a complete small-format sawmill round wood with minimal processing in finished wood is transformed. In larger sawmills, the LAIMET 120 can work effectively in conjunction with edge trimmers and saws, or as a second saw in conjunction with a Ribbon cutter or a hacksaw for the conversion of heavy wood.

The LAIMET 120 is equipped with almost identical features as the LAIMET 130, but has a lighter framework. The LAIMET 120 sawmill has a hydraulically driven, toothed roll, which is synchronized with the table speed. The feed roller keeps his drive and speed despite uneven surfaces of tree trunk. The LAIMET 120 is usually equipped with turning bars on both sides of the table, to throw light material and a deflector arm to timber to unload when the table comes back. The wheel above the deflector arm supports heavy plates so that they can be returned to the operator for another cut. The blade is properly protected and the operator is located at the good distance to the sawing process, so that the LAIMET sawmill can be described as very safe.

The KAESER Airtower 26 is designed for light industrial applications, such as motor vehicle maintenance and repair. The compressor is affordable and tough, featuring an all-in-one compressed air system with a refrigerated air dryer.

KAESER Airtower 26 Features

The KAESER Airtower 26 has a compact design, leaving a small footprint for workshops of all sizes. The machine’s design allows for easy servicing and maintenance. The Airtower 26 is fitted with a compressor and refrigeration dryer that are not enclosed together like similar machines. Instead, each one is housed in its own control cabinet. This means the compressor and refrigeration dryer can be operated independently, and one can still be used when the other is being services. The Airtower 26 offers an output of 220 cubic metres per hour. The compressor is fitted with a 15-kilowatt (20-horsepower) engine.

HILTI PR15 Laser Cutting Machine

The HILTI PR15 Self-Levelling Rotating Laser provides high standards of accuracy. The tool is ideal for on-site work, including excavations and setting levels for pouring concrete. It is also designed to level and align formwork, as well as align façade panels. Operators can also use the PR15 to position drywall track, level suspended ceilings, install pipes and cable trays, and set water or drainage pipes.

HILTI PR15 Features & Specs

The HILTI PR15 features an automatic alignment system for quick measurements using a laser beam that offers exceptional accuracy to 400 millimetres. The tool is also fitted with an automatic shock sensor that helps reduce errors. Operators can set slops at plus or minus five degrees. A display is also incorporated to show the current operating status.

Weighing 2.4 kilograms or 5.3 pounds, the HILTI PR 15 is lightweight and portable. The rotating laser is 186 millimetres or 7.3 inches long, 186 millimetres or 7.3 inches wide, and 213 millimetres or 8.4 inches wide. The PR15 can be used directly on the ground or using a tripod. It can also be used with a wall or rail mounting.

Bobcat T190 Compact Track Loader Specs

The Bobcat T190 rubber track system delivers excellent flotation, smooth ride and more efficient use of power in tough digging conditions.

Equipped with a hefty 56-hp-turbo-charges Kubota diesel engine, the T190 specs characterised by an impressive power, a hydraulic breakout force and superior tractive effort, allowing quick work of digging, loading, pushing, backfilling, grading, spreading and carrying materials. The increased flotation and the minimal ground disturbance are especially benefits when working on soft ground or landscaped areas. 

T190 compact track loader runs where others can’t!

The low-profile lift arms of the Bobcat T190 give a great view from the operator’s seat, whereas the vertical lift path provides excellent reach since it can lift up to 1.900 lbs. Other specs offer the operating weight of the T190 is 7.775 lbs, around 20% lighter than the average compact track loader. Only 66.0 inches wide (68.0" with bucket), the K-series T190 maveuvers easily when space is limited. The Bobcat T190 has a net power output of 66 HP and can travel at speeds up to 7.3 mph.

Product Pictures of Bobcat T190

 

Standard narrow tracks are ideal for maximum traction and pushing force, and optional wide tracks for best flotation on sand and turf. Bobcat T300 offers options such as shock-absorbing ride control for a smoother ride, enclosed heated and air conditioned cab, as well as the Power Bob-Tach™ system for easy attachment changes.

Different attachments and accessories are also available for the T190, such as earth auger, hydraulic breaker, forks, grapple bucket, smooth bucket, and tooth bucket.  With the Bobcat T190, you thus get more than a simple compact loader.

Concerning Ford 7610 power, it has a PTO claimed at 86 hp (64.1) and a drawbar of 74 hp (55.1 kW). The Ford 7610 can be a two wheel drive or a four wheel drive tractor with ROPS and optional cab. With 18.4x34 rear tires, the Ford 7610 farm tractor has a maximum speed of 30 km/h (18.6 mph) with dual-range transmission including 8 forward and 2 reverse gears. However, the 7610 can also use a Dual Power partial power shift transmission adding a shift-on-the-move to an under-speed on the basic 8/2 gear transmission.

Fendt 818 Vario Tractor

The Fendt 818 Vario has been introduced in 2006 by Fendt. With the 800 series Vario, Fendt introduced the new generation of compact high-horsepower tractors, offering professional operators everything they need. Combining the engine and hydraulic performance of a heavy-duty tractor with the versatility and maneuverability of a smaller tractor, the Fendt 818 Vario has already become the best selling mid-sized high-horsepower tractor in Europe.  

Thanks to its Deutz 6-cylinder turbocharged inter cooled diesel engine, the Fendt 818 Vario tractor has a maximum engine power output of 185 hp (138 kW). With a continuously variable transmission (CVT) including 2-range forward and reverse gears, it has a top speed of 50 km/h (31 mph). As standard equipment, the 818 Vario features a headland management system (or electronics platform), Variotronic, the Fendt tractor management system, TMS, and an integral front 3-point hitch. It is also equipped with a front axle suspension, a cab suspension and a 4-wheel drive chassis. In addition, the Fendt 818 Vario farm tractor includes 4 electric remotes, a hydraulic trailer braking system and a dynamic exhausting system.

Fendt 714 Vario Tractor Specs & Features

The Fendt 714 Vario farm tractor is also equipped with may specifications and by its exceptional compact dimensions (see below), enabling a wide range of features. This tractor is also equipped with a front lift - with increased lift capacities on the rear 3-point hitch -, a 152 lpm hydraulic pump, a front axle suspension system and a 4-wheel drive chassis. With a maximal speed of 31 mph (50 km/h) at a fuel-saving 1,700 rpm, the Fendt 714 Vario has an excellent power-to-weight ratio of 79 lbs/hp (36 kg/hp). Ford 8210 Farming Tractor Specs

Originally derived from the Ford 8200 as a "special project" to fill a gap in range, the Ford 8210 was introduced in 1982 and discontinued in 1991 when it was replaced by the Ford 8240 model. 

This modern farm tractor from Fendt is equipped with a 6-cylinder diesel engine which produces 110 hp (82 kW) with a displacement of 401 cm inches (6.6 litres). Providing 95 PTO hp, the Ford 8210 tractor is supplied by a powershift gear transmission with 16 forward and 8 reverse speeds. With a lift capacity of 4,400 lbs (2000 kg), the 8210 from Ford weighs 9,370 lbs (4250 kg). It is 174.7 inches (443 cm) long, 114 inches (289 cm) tall to top of the cab, and has a 109.6 inches (278 cm) wheelbase. With a 4x4 MFWD 4WD chassis, the Ford 8210 row crop tractor features 3 remotes, a cab standard with air-conditioning and a category 2 rear three-point hitch. It also includes a beacon light, a grille guard and a block heater. According to your requirements, the Ford 8210 can also be equipped with a loader.

The Ford 8N was introduced in 1947 and manufactured until 1952 by Ford. 442,035 units were built during that period. Painted lighter shade of gray on the sheetmetal and bright red cast iron on the body, the 8N was proved to be the top-selling farm tractor of all time in North America. Also part of the N-series tractors, it has been differentiated from the 9N and 2N models with the change in lugs from six to eight in the rear wheels.

The Ford 8N tractor is equipped with a 4-cylinder gas engine producing 23.2 PTO hp (17.3 kW) and 27.3 drawbar horsepower (20.4 kW). The 8N from Ford uses Ferguson hydraulic-controlled three-point hitch and includes a 4-speed constant mesh transmission instead of a 3-speed in the 2N and 9N. Please notice that the 8N must be stopped and clutch used to shift between gears. It also features a "position-control" setting for the hydraulics in order to improve flexibility in varying soil conditions. The Ford 8N was equipped with running boards, a 2WD chassis, a side-mounted distributor, a Proofmeter (combining speedmeter, hour meter and tachometer) and a flip-up seat. It was the first Ford tractor to feature a clutch on the left side and independent brakes on the right. The Ford 8N utility tractor is characterized by helical gears using through out transmission, brake pedals both on right side, recirculating ball steering, raised steering wheel position, as well as rounded rear wheels and small hub front wheels.

History of the DECKEL FP1

The DECKEL company was founded in the early years of the 20th century in germany. The machine tool business grew from the core business of the camera industry: camera shutters, with the trade name "Compur", a product that has been used by industry leaders.

The basics of FP1 can be traced back to the year 1917,the machine's first desings were developed in the 1920s and simply promoted by the factory as "fp". To distinguish these models from the later types that are now very common, often referred to as "Type F0". The machine was intended mainly for the production of stamping dies. But in the early 1930s, the model has been enriched for FP1 a group of machines that can be considered as prototypes. These first models had a table feed rate of 250 mm (300 mm for later models). By the end of world war 2, in 1945 approximately 4100 machines of FP1 were produced. Manufacturing camera shutters remained the center of their business. Even in 1953 the 50th anniversary of the company, their brochure was devoted almost exclusively to camera-associated products. By early 50's and with the introduction of new versions of FP1, fp2 and other high-quality milling machines and accessories a new company was created, separate from camera products. The results were impressive so much that until 1965 approximately 50,000 copies of the FP1 milling machine were sold.

Ford 4000 All Purpose Tractor 
Founded: June 16, 1903
Headquarters: Dearborn, Michigan US

 In November 1915, Henry Ford organized the Henry Ford and Son Company to develop a farm tractor and build a tractor factory, because the other stockholders of the Ford Motor Company didn’t want their rich dividends diluted by the cost of developing a tractor.By 1964, a whole new Ford tractor range included no less than three tractors featuring a three-cylinder motor, including the best-selling Ford 4000. No other tractor manufacturer embraced the power of three to the same extent as Ford and the success of the 4000 model and its successors proved they were right!

History: The early 4000 line was sold into 1965 though production stopped in 1964 when the U.S. assembly line transitioned to build the new designs. Nearly 10,000 four-cylinder 4000s were built. Ford collectors generally differentiate the two versions by calling the older unit the “4000 four-cylinder” and the later one the “4000 three-cylinder,” or sometimes the “Basildon 4000,” after the plant in England where they were designed and built.

History

Since 1928, Fendt has been recognized as the world leader in tractor technology. In the past seven-plus decades, Fendt has been the first with a CVT transmission, first with a multi-point suspension system and the first with full control of all drive functions and hydraulics via a single joystick. Even today, Fendt offers features that are unavailable at any price on other farm tractors.

Performances:

The Fendt 936 Vario broke all records in DLG PowerMix test and surpasses  the previous record held by the 828 Vario. Witha a fuel consumption of only 240 g/kWh, the high - horsepower tractor with Fendt  Efficient Technology sets a new benchmark.                                       The 240 g/kWh means 59 g/kWh of fuel are saved over the PowerMax average. That means  20% less diesel overall. The Fendt 936 Vario - best in its calss.

Engine: 

Engine Fuel-efficient power -The rugged 7.8-liter, 6-cylinder turbocharged and air-to-air aftercooled Deutz engine, featuring four-valve technology, provides up to 300 PTO horsepower and up to 1,104 foot pounds of torque (936 Vario*). Renowned for its excellent fuel economy and quiet operation, this robust power plant incorporates the most advanced electronic engine control system available for peak performance. Part of the credit goes to the common-rail, high-pressure fuel injection system with injection pressures up to 29,008 PSI. Electronically controlled injection timing and volume that is independent of piston stroke further improves power and torque characteristics, as well as fuel economy and emissions quality.

Breathe easy - Equipped with new Fendt SCR (selective catalytic reduction) technology, the 900 Series is a breath of fresh air, both literally and financially. Not only do these tractors meet all current Tier 4i emissions standards, but they provide up to 7% better fuel economy than their predecessors. Because the system treats the exhaust externally, there’s no need to recirculate exhaust gas back into the engine or force it through complex filters. Instead, diesel exhaust fluid (DEF), which consists of urea in a purified water solution, is injected into an SCR catalyst in the exhaust system where it reacts with heat to reduce nitrogen oxide to harmless nitrates and water vapor. This means the engine can be tuned for peak performance and power, rather than emissions control.
